It is characterized by its distinctive, strap-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the cooler months. Vellozia brachypoda is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
